Hanover Public Schools added 123 new photos ‚Äî at Hanover High School.
March 28 ¬∑

The Credit for Life Fair is an interactive event held annually for the senior class.
The day began with a brief presentation in the auditorium where students viewed a Consumer Reports video about the student loan debt crisis. Students then moved into the gymnasium to visit fifteen booths, including Transportation, Housing, and Nutrition. At each booth, students were asked to make some of the financial decisions that they will have to make as adults. Students select the most appealing option presented to them by volunteers from the community, and then decide how to pay for it; whether it be using their net monthly income, a credit card, or by spending their savings. Students also participated in a mock interview.

The event was a tremendous success. We are very thankful to our volunteers and Hanover High School teachers and staff who made this event possible.

Photos courtesy of Stephen Ryerson, Town of Hanover

We look forward to sharing the summer with your students.
